Package critter2.checks

Class Summary
CheckAsserts Warns if pointer parameters not validated by an assert
CheckBeginningComment Warns if there is no comment in the beginning of each file.
CheckEmptyCompound Warns against empty compound statements
CheckFileLength Warns if file exceeds a maximum length (MAX_FILE_LENGTH), measured by lines.
CheckFunctionCommentValid Warns if function comment fails to mention each parameter by name or explain what the function returns.
CheckFunctionHasEnoughComments Warns if functions don’t have enough local comments.
CheckFunctionLengthByLines Warns if a function length exceeds a maximum length (MAX_FUNCTION_LENGTH).
CheckFunctionLengthByStatements Work in progress...
CheckFunctionNaming Warns if not all functions in non-main modules have the same prefix.
CheckFunctionNumber Warns if number of functions in a file exceeds maximum number (MAX_FUNCTION_NUMBER).
CheckFunctionParams Warns if a function has too many parameters (MAX_PARAMETER_NUMBER).
CheckGlobalHasComment Warns if global variables are missing comments.
CheckGoTos Warns against using goto statements.
CheckLoop Warn if loop length exceeds a maximum line length (MAX_LOOP_LENGTH).
CheckMagicNumbers Warns against using magic numbers outside of declarations (except 0, 1, and 2 in case statements.) Additionally warns against using #define because all #defines are replaced during the preprocessing done by CritterDriver.
CheckNesting Warn if area of code is too deeply nested.
CheckStructHasComment Warns if a field in a struct lacks comments.
CheckSwitchCases Warns if a switch case is missing a break (or return) statement.
CheckSwitchHasDefaultCase Warns if a switch is missing a default case.
CheckVariableName Checks that variable names are longer than the MIN_VAR_NAME_LENGTH, with the exception of ACCEPTABLE_VAR_NAMES.
SampleCheck A sample class to write new checks.
